messageBody:
Vladimir Bossicard wrote:
> I imagine a tool that parses your classes and generates a
> specific TestCase class with methods to test your public
> methods? Let's say: you have a method that can throw
> exceptions A, B or C, your generated file will have 3 methods
> (testThrowA, testThrowB, testThrowC...) with (almost) empty
> bodies. Does it make sense?
>
> BTW anyone thinks that it is a good idea? (the tool is IDE
> independant of course).

Well, this isn't IDE independant, but... check out the JUnit module for
NetBeans. It does exactly this, and I routinely use it over my older code,
or code written by other developers here, to see what's not tested.

Robert.
